Row.Text: Bored workers have created a game of chance involving dice. Their supervisors consider it a nuisance, but they could be seduced by the prospect of making extra money.
Some walk away from the dice with heavy pockets – excited to tell their friends how to play.
An isolated community has recovered from the ravages of a plague. They cannot rebuild on their own.
Help them to find a new home.
Allow them to determine their own fates.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
New lives await the survivors, with a new hope kindling in their hearts.
Shipwrights have dreamed up a fearsome warship, but few have ever worked on a project as complex. Disorder has bred massive construction delays.
Fund and organize the building process.
The ship is christened in the name of the {1_civilization_adj} civilization. The great sea serpents will tremble in her wake.
Unemployed sailors cluster around the docks of the port. There are too few ships, too little work, too much time.
They will have to learn new skills.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Civic.
One timber at a time, the gates of the shipping port are rebuilt, as are the lives of those who work there.
This cave is rumored to be the home of fell beasts that hunt and kill those unlucky enough to wander too close.
The creatures are nowhere to be found, perhaps existing only in legend. Nevertheless, the effort was noticed.
A band of leaderless mercenaries has begun scavenging to fill their empty stomachs. Their prowess in battle is legendary, but without direction, they are withering.
The warriors come alive, sharing tales of triumph over a hearty meal. In gratitude, they pledge fealty to the {1_civilization_adj} civilization.
A seaside structure holds a great meeting room of all the nearby clans. Here, they decide conflicts through long debate and careful persuasion.
Speeches punctuated by the roaring of the waves – perhaps they will be useful at home, perhaps not.
Butchers have perfected a technique for cooking with smoke. Their tents belch out mouth-watering plumes while calloused hands shuffle charred meat over hot coals. A feast is forged.
Smoke carries the smell of slow-roasted meat into the heavens. Curious travelers are drawn in for miles.
An aged horseman has retired, but their frontline knowledge is more valuable than gold. They might train the next generation in exchange for help rebuilding their family's humble estate.
The cavalry parades through a field. Their uniforms show no signs of wear, yet they march with a lifetime of experience.
An ancient barrow from a long-past time lies alongside the road, its form almost unrecognizable beneath the growing turf.
No gold, no riches, but the carefully-carved votive figures of a long-past people line the interior.
Farmers have claimed a traveling prophet cursed their well for showing poor hospitality. Those who drink its water grow sick, and neighboring villages are falling into despair.
The aquifer was tainted. A new well, in a new valley, will bring new life.
Natural philosophers have begun using water to filter saltpeter from cave dirt. Massive quantities of explosives could be produced if they had larger processing tanks.
Save some saltpeter for further study.
Explosive powders paint the night sky with fire, but an ominous tone hangs in the air.
Peasants here find that the soil surrounding these ancient stones is particularly good for growing tea.
Take samples of the soil for study.
Take the stones to divine their magic.
The rich soil patch can be expanded, and tea flourishes there.
A holy site draws congregants from around the region to worship in its cool depths. Gold veins glisten in the walls.
Clear the sect and seize the cave.
The cave is quickly emptied of its sacred objects. Now, workers might be brought here to extract its resources.
A rich stand of thick timber fuels a burgeoning community of charcoal burners.
Negotiate a trade deal with the burners.
The dense fuel causes forges and furnaces to blaze with light.
Along a craggy shore, colonies of pelicans swarm one another in pursuit of dinner. Fish here are so abundant that one can practically scoop them from the sea by hand.
The shore's unusual formation allows for a prosperous ecosystem. Balance produces abundance...but not for birds.
Contractors repairing a temple foundation have discovered a deposit of jade. The precious stone would make superb jewelry, and the workers have offered to dig out the mine...but not for free.
Contractors excavate jade by the cartload. This investment should soon pay for itself.
Under a collapsing archway, a young orphan has built a flimsy shelter. They say their family was taken by illness and are eager to distance themselves from the memories.
Train the child to map the land.
Find a family to care for the child.
Now that the young apprentice knows how to read the land, they set off to conquer it.
An expert theologian has been exiled from their homeland for speaking against its rule. Their skill with oratory could prove useful.
Their discontent has turned to political advantage for the {1_civilization_adj} civilization.
The second son of the rulers of {1_Independent} shows an unusual aptitude for trade...and a willingness to join the {2_civilization_adj} Empire.
{1_independent} becomes Hostile (removes all progress towards Befriending).
{1_independent} has issued many insults, but they cannot be heard over the din of clinking coins.
On the outskirts of settled lands, a wealthy pilgrimage has stalled as the members argue about the finer points of theology.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Civic.
With no resolution in sight, one of the loudest critics suddenly goes missing. Consensus is reached.
Shockingly spicy peppers have sprouted through the cracks in a jagged bluff. Some love the flavor; others seem bizarrely compelled to challenge their companions to eat them.
The colorful peppers are a delight for the eyes. Their pleasure on the tongue is still up for debate.
A violent storm has snapped the masts of a commercial sailing ship. The damage is substantial but a local shipwright believes the abandoned vessel can be repaired.
In the breeze, the sails swell with a snap. Water laps gently at the bow.
A renowned inventor has been pulled from the sea. They claim to have been on the verge of a monumental scientific breakthrough, but all their equipment was lost to the waves.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Technology.
The inventor's work has led to significant advances, but the journey of discovery has barely begun.
A pirate ship has foundered, its hold filled with strange cargo: soldiers from a rival civilization.
Give the soldiers a new home.
Return the soldiers to their old home.
Gain 1 Population in the nearest Settlement.
The former soldiers adapt slowly to their new society.
A distant field contains wondrous flowers never before seen. These would be valuable if cultivated back home.
A pacifist sect has established a farming commune around a mound they claim as holy. They offer to share their bounty.
A monk has developed a method for affixing lenses to the face, granting clarity to those with frail vision. Glass twists the sun's light, bringing nature's structure into sharp focus.
Find other uses for these lenses.
Atop a crag, one engineer has built a windmill. Strong winds help mill raw trees into usable planks. Builders are already clamoring for this high-quality lumber.
Touring merchants have begun selling snake bile as a cure for gout. However, skeptics argue this restorative is only good for one thing: turning a profit.
An itinerant mystic has made spiced cider from fruit trees planted along his journey. Crowds are already gathering to enjoy the beverage and listen to his sermons.
A renowned playwright has sought inspiration in the countryside. Their lyrical reflections on mortality often bring audiences to tears, but their latest masterwork could surpass all expectations.
A merchant vessel from a neighboring country has crashed on its maiden voyage. Fortunately, all the passengers have been retrieved. Better still, so have the treasures it holds.
Salvagers have recovered a golden figurehead from the hulk of a shipwrecked galleon. Ancient mariners claim that this will tame the murderous seas.
This stretch of ocean has long been known for its danger. In this wreck are found charts that may help plot a safer course.
A naval vessel has captured a band of deadly pirates. The courts are interrogating their story, but outsized tales of their exploits are already circulating in countryside taverns.
Shepherds have been breeding goats with an exceptionally soft undercoat. Lavish textiles spun from these fine fibers have already created a bidding war among artisans.
A herd of thoroughbreds has begun grazing among the stones of a deserted shrine. Crowds would surely gather, coin in hand, to watch these magnificent beasts unleash their speed.
An overgrown temple has become the sanctuary for a rare breed of hawk. The wealthy elite offer fortunes for pets of such plumage. The ultimate status symbol: kings of the sky chained to a cage.
Ancient scientists have developed a system of interconnected lenses – a window into the night sky. The view from this forgotten observatory is the perfect place to ponder our place in the cosmos.
Open the building to all comers.
An engineer has refined their recipe for bricks. Builders marvel over the strength of the stones, promising to build structures that withstand the ravages of war, fire, and time.
Under the cover of night, a scientist has been performing illicit experiments on cadavers. Their publication on the body's inner workings is already causing a stir among physicians.
A historian has been scouring caves, looking for creatures to add to their compendium of beasts. Their descriptions of fangs and scales terrify children...who can't help but spread the legend.
A raging fire has dimmed to embers, but the camp's remaining contents still smolder. Supplies lie smoking along one side of the wreckage; on the other, a crate of unknown texts.
In the shadow of a collapsed mill, vintners experiment with sour grapes. A recipe of spices and honey brings poor wine to life, reducing waste. Life's celebrations are punctuated by fine drink.
Dog trainers have gathered in a demolished granary to organize a wild hunt. Nobles trade sacks of coin for hounds that can bound over acres without breaking a sweat.
A master surgeon has designed more comfortable iron prosthetics for those who lost a limb in battle. Despite their pain, these patients are proud to return to work.
Bring the workers to the capital.
A scholar has devised a new way of calculating the ideal time to seed fields using an astrolabe – a map of the heavens in one's palm. Their system greatly improves farm yields.
Encourage farmers to adopt the system.
At a roadside market, a shopkeeper has revealed a hat crafted from exotic animal skins. Supplies are already running thin as wealthy trendsetters drive up the price.
One biologist's complex herbal concoctions have proved to be powerful digestive aids. Pilgrims gather at their doorstep seeking relief from a variety of unusual ailments.
A journeyman has engineered a more efficient tide mill, taking advantage of the ocean's ever-changing swells to turn inedible grains into market-ready flours.
A family of farmers has been experimenting with crop rotations and letting fields lie fallow. Their labor-saving methods for a bountiful harvest will feed many mouths.
Teams of laborers have refined the process of extracting salt from evaporating seawater. They scoop white crystals from large iron vats and package them for sale – dreams of profit in their eyes.
A famed sculptor has discovered a superior method of gathering clay from the seabed. By reshaping the earth, they mold effigies that express human pain, joy, and triumph.
The half-sunk vessel clings to the surface of the water, a cruel reminder that any attempt to cross the sea is a foolish affront to nature. But where this crew failed, another may succeed.
Seafarers have discovered a trading vessel adrift at sea. The crew succumbed to an invisible plague, but local clergy seem more concerned for the safety of sacred relics in the vessel's hold.
A band of mariners has been using diving bells to salvage valuable goods and precious materials from a sunken trading ship.
A patrolling navy ship has hauled a castaway up from the brine. The sailor's multi-year hunt for a legendary sea monster ended in failure, but his outsized tales of daring may outlive him.
A sounder of wild hogs has been terrorizing the countryside and uprooting gardens. Fortunately, a wealthy nomad has devised specialized traps to capture the beasts and preserve their valuable hides.
Inside a scriptorium, a scribe has been reproducing a withered philosophical codex – the mysteries of the universe preserved between sketches of large-nosed demons.
Famed musicians have begun lining up at a misanthropic artisan's door. The musical instruments she shapes from driftwood are as much a work of art as the sounds they produce.
In the hollow of a cave, masons have devised new tools for quickly shaping stone. Architects will readily pay for this new wealth of cleanly-cut marble.
After the accidental death of their leader, a company of mercenaries has taken a religious vow and thrown down their weapons. Hands that burned a village make ready to rebuild one.
Let them work in the capital.
A family of farmers has been experimenting with new combinations of manure and clay to fertilize their fields. With time, acrid waste yields mouth-watering produce.
Sell the harvest at a premium.
In a busy workshop, three brothers have designed a harp-playing automaton from an assortment of precise gears. These skilled engineers are already drawing crowds and royal commissions.
Enshrine their work in the capital.
An unusual number of ships have disappeared in this region. One explorer believes the phenomenon should be studied. Merchants would rather avoid the area to alleviate trade disruptions.
As explorers learn ever more about the natural order, they realize how much more they have yet to learn.
A ship of strange design founders in the surf, its broken hull creaking under the pressure of the waves. Perhaps it could be set aright.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Technology.
The ship sits atop the waters again – for a moment. Its masts dip into the water as its hull breaks anew. But we have learned from its design.
Plenty of Fish in the Sea
The hulk of a sunken warship gives shelter to vast shoals of fish. Local fishermen flock to these waters for their bounty.
Plenty of Fish in the Sea
The new wrecks provide increased shelter for even greater shoals of fish.
A strange beast crashes through the undergrowth: a tangle of horns on its head and a constellation of spots on its side.
Fund an expedition to study the wildlife here.
The wonder of the animals here have been recorded – imperfectly – on paper.
A foreign noble observes a group of young people who have gathered in a field to kick a ball through a central hoop. The game could act as a bridge between two polities.
The noble has returned, filled with stories about how the {1_civilization_adj} sport has exploded in popularity among the nearby village of {2_independent}.
This village is wracked with discord. Some have accused a growing number of residents of witchcraft. Others decry the injustice.
Gain a boost to the earliest available Civic.
The living may argue over virtues, but the justice of the court speaks for the dead.
A wild dog had taken to randomly traveling with caravans, offering welcome companionship over grueling treks before vanishing over the horizon. The beloved animal has become a legend among travelers.
The life of a dog is fleeting, but the songs they inspire impart immortality.
A wealthy merchant's daughter has begun experimenting with alchemy. She claims that certain stones can draw gold from seawater.
The stones do not work as intended, drawing iron instead of gold. Useful, if not as profitable.
A master bowyer has developed a technique for shaping bows faster than anyone has ever seen. However, they have no heir and worry their methods will die with them.
Freshly supplied archers practice their craft as expertly crafted bows send arrows dancing across the sky.
An order of veterans has set up a camp to treat the sick and injured, whatever their side in the conflict.
Shun those who offer succor to an enemy.
Soldiers leave the fields scarred and disfigured, but alive.
Combing the day’s catch near a shipwreck, fishermen find a bottle containing a treasure map. Are the pirate legends true, or is this some sailor’s idea of a joke?
There is buried treasure nowhere on the island, but the fishermen have not been played for fools after all: the bountiful grove they discover bears more than enough riches.
Desperate sailors spot a promising looking crate among the debris. The skies above warn of an oncoming storm – if they do not pull the loot up now, there may not be a second chance.
The storm breaks over the sailors, and their ship founders. But before it does, a rich cargo is pulled from the wreck.
To Read, or Not to Read
A cave contains the remains of a diplomat's caravan. In his belongings, a letter addressed to his wife, announcing that he no longer loves her.
To Read, or Not to Read
She takes the letter and reads it. Her eyes betray her torment. "I am glad to know," she says, not glad.
Amidst the ruins are small jars containing crushed powders and brightly pigmented unguents. Fingertip marks carve out hollows in the long-unused substances. Their purpose is difficult to determine.
Take these to people who might know what they are.
After many conversations, a breakthrough is made – these are clearly cosmetics. The formula is easy to replicate, and soon a fad for the paints sweeps through the {1_civilization_adj} people.
A rival ship has run aground, their tattered colors lying limply among the wreckage.
Return the flag to its owner.
What's left of a ship is kept company by crustaceans picking at bits of metal and flesh. These scavengers make it hard for the dead to sleep.
A navy commander summons her crew to examine the debris. This shipwrecked vessel is a lesson in defeat – but how was it felled?
At first glance, the wreck looks innocuous. A closer inspection reveals indents of swords and spears, a deadly dance performed in close quarters.
Leave the weapons as a show of respect.
Helmets float around the wreckage, telling a gruesome tale of defeat. As the gig approaches, a soldier scoops one up.
Take the helmet as a trophy.
A dog circles the overturned supply wagon, sniffing at limbs pinned beneath the wreck. Some still breathe, but they are dazed and aimless.
Take some goods and send them on their way.
A scavenger rummages through the decadence left behind – fruits, perfumes and oils from faraway lands, and smiles.
Staggered footprints lead away from the makeshift lodging, leaving a trail of blood and coins. A cane lies snapped in half. Whoever was injured could not have gone far.
Find the victim and bandage their wounds.
An adventurer stops in their tracks. A murder of crows drop offerings of shiny coins and rocks at the base of the ruins.
Follow the crows back to their trinkets.
The locals have repurposed this ancient monolith as a burial site. Whatever its original use, now it stands sentinel over the departed.
Ask them what they think the monolith was.

A small trading post here is constantly plagued by pirates and highwaymen. A merchant league would offer protection and other benefits, but the most outspoken traders worry they would lose their independence.
Offer them protection – for a price.
A rushing waterfall echoes against the vast walls of an undergound cave, the spray shimmering in a beam of sunlight. No one has been here in years.
One of this coastal village's elders has died. A ship has been prepared to serve as his grave, to ensure he has safe passage to the afterlife.
Stay for a raucous toast to the departed.
Colliers live alone in this wood far removed from society, and tend to an ever-burning charcoal pit. Locals avoid them, having heard tales of the colliers' wickedness.
A manor house was abandoned many years ago, and now plants and animals have made it their home. A sapling has finally pierced the roof, and reaches for the sky.
Tragedians perform the mystery of a religious prophet for a modest crowd. Afterward, they pack up their pageant wagon, hoping to find a more rapt audience in the next city.
The pilgrims rescued from the sea had been bound for distant lands when they hit rough waters here. Now, their dreams of religious freedom sink with their ship.
Peasants have taken up arms against their landlord, who fills his coffers with the labor and taxation of others. As the peasants overwhelm the manor house, the guards are powerless to stop them.
A once-proud road was first overtaken by beasts and bandits. Now, after years of neglect, a mudslide has consumed what little remained.
Restore the road so commerce may flow.
Leave the road blocked to serve as a defense.
Dust-caked feet tread freshly laid stones as travelers murmur prayers, hoping this new road will lead to fortune.
A ring of megaliths stands in a circle. Their placement appears deliberate.
Mark where the stones align with the sunrise.
Every plane is cut to perfection, every angle considered, leaving no room for error.
The remaining members of an expedition are lost, and have camped here while their supplies dwindle. They say they had undererstimated how hostile these lands would be.
Grateful for the assistance, the explorers pledge to spread work of {1_civilization_adj} kindness.
A community has been unable to work these lands, as their crops inevitably become diseased. Many blame the miasma they claim emanates from a nearby cave system.
Cleanse the air with fragrant wood.
Promise them work in the capital.
The farmers can plant again, no longer fearing the bad air.
Commemorating a local naval victory, teams compete in mock battle on platforms suspended from row boats. The crowd cheers as an enemy combatant plunges into the frigid water.
Place a bet on the next joust.
The clinking of coins is a satisfying accompaniment to the cheers of victory.
A local lord has called for war, and demands every able-bodied peasant to muster. The peasants live on and work his lands at his pleasure, and cannot refuse.
Convince them to fight for the {1_Civilization_Adj} people.
Their lord's ire quelled, the peasants return to their pitchforks and ploughs.

The library of a remote monastery has gone up in flames, the source of which remains a mystery among piles of rubble and scorched texts. The monks lament that centuries of work and knowledge may be lost forever.
Help the monks recover what they can.
In gratitude, the monastery's scribes offer copies of their most prized manuscripts.
A local warlord hopes to conquer a small but prosperous farming community with words rather than force. He has offered to hear their concerns at his itinerant court.
Bribe the warlord to leave them be.
{1_Independent} is glad to be rid of the warlord, at least until he returns with arms.
This merchant ship's crew chose and failed to defend itself, and another shipping lane has fallen prey to pirates. But perhaps some order can be brought to the high seas.
The seas near {1_independent} are safer, for now.
